lexUnit.name: puzzle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confuse because difficult to understand.

sentence.text: One thing that had puzzled early observers was the litter of ani eggs strewn beneath the nest .
What has most puzzled students of the period is the complete disappearance of the Picts as a distinct entity within a very short time .
What puzzled Jack was that he himself was very happy at Bradley Fold West and he had settled into the routine and managed the duties without any problems .
What puzzled Jaq was that the Genestealer rebellion , now so bloodily suppressed , was a natural threat .
What puzzled me was , where was the body ?
` What 's puzzling me is that phone-call Nicola had at the party .
What puzzles me is why we do n't do the obvious and go and find him .
It puzzled him beyond measure that the boy should have stumbled upon this private area .

It must sometimes puzzle the Russians how easy it is to plant such nonsense on British intelligence but what they do not appreciate is that if defectors did not invent such silly tales MI5 and MI6 would do so themselves anyway .
She did remember that a word sounding like ` sewers " was uttered , and it puzzled her to think why anyone should be ringing in the middle of the night to enquire about the state of the sewers .
The signal box is the setting for an unexplained sequence of events that to this day have puzzled the local authorities .
As he glanced up at her , his eyes shuttered , she found herself asking another question that had been puzzling her for a while .
A cloud passed over Jessica 's face , which puzzled him .
But the church puzzled him .
So do n't hesitate to ask them about anything that may be worrying or puzzling you .
We would thus , no doubt , be much puzzled by the occasional glimpse of the great metropolises , particularly since only the towering edifices of their tourist attractions were usually portrayed .
Small children who see grandparents frequently are likely to be distressed and puzzled by their death .
He was puzzled by George 's attitude , which appeared hostile , although he could think of no reason why .
Mathilde was puzzled by Isabelle 's apparent change of heart .
She was puzzled by the gravity of Creed 's tone .
The reason is that if the examiner is reading your script quickly ( and he may have hundreds of scripts to mark ) he may be puzzled and annoyed by your departure from the order of his question .
This discovery explained observations that had puzzled elephant watchers .
On his return he puzzled me by behaving exactly as I expected an S.S.O. to behave .
Will he explain something that puzzles many Opposition Members as well as many voters ?
This puzzles some people but the reason becomes clear in the following example .
